Kambakkht Ishq is a film that involves the process of filming.
In January 2008, filming for Kambakkht Ishq took place.
Kambakkht Ishq was filmed in Los Angeles.
Reports indicated that Arnold Schwarzenegger was signed on to appear in Kambakkht Ishq.
Kambakkht Ishq was reported to feature a performance by Beyoncé.
Due to extensive pre-production work on the film, the filming for Kambakkht Ishq was shifted from January 2008 to May 2008.
Kambakkht Ishq is the first Indian film to be shot within Universal Studios, as announced by Nadiadwala.
Pivotal scenes of Kambakkht Ishq were filmed at the Kodak Theatre.
After completing their overseas schedule, the production team headed to Venice, Italy for further filming of Kambakkht Ishq.
After completing their overseas schedule, the production team also headed to Mumbai, India for further filming of Kambakkht Ishq.
For the project in Venice, Italy, Kambakkht Ishq was shot.
After completing their overseas schedule, the production team of Kambakkht Ishq later headed to shoot in Mumbai, India.
During December 2008, reports surfaced indicating that Kumar and Kapoor would appear alongside Carmen Electra in a promotional music video for the film.
In February 2009, Nadiadwala announced that Electra wouldn't be appearing in the music video and was replaced by the music group RDB.
The first trailer of the film was shown alongside the release of Jehangir Surti's film Aa Dekhen Zara (2009).
The music of this movie was primarily composed by Anu Malik,
with RDB and Salim–Sulaiman as guest composers.
Before the film's worldwide release of 3 July 2009, advance bookings for Kambakkht Ishq officially commenced from 28 June onwards to positive response from the public.

node_2: bollywood film with highest grossing of all time
edge: Kambakkht Ishq is a Bollywood film that holds the record for highest grossing of all time in Indian cinema.
In its opening weekend in India, Kambakkht Ishq grossed Rs 245.0 million from 1,400 screens.
At the end of its first week, Kambakkht Ishq collected a total of Rs 359.5 million.
During its second week at the box office, the film showed a 70% drop in its collections.
Eros International released Kambakkht Ishq overseas in over 600 screens.
In the United Kingdom, the film debuted at number 8 and grossed £ 299,533 on 56 screens.
Noyon Jyoti Parasara from AOL India concluded, "The film has nothing going for it. It has a worryingly bad script, horrible screenplay, traumatising dialogues and unpleasant music."

node_2: indian films on the world stage
edge: The author describes Kambakkht Ishq as a shame when it comes to watching Indian films on the world stage, implying that it fails to meet the standards expected from Indian films that are showcased globally.
Rajeev Masand, a critic from CNN-IBN, gave the film 1 star out of 5 and referred to it as 'a loud, vulgar and seriously offensive film'.
Taran Adarsh, a critic from indiaFM, mentioned that the film would strike a chord with the youth.
Taran Adarsh also noted that the film would appeal to those who enjoy such kinds of movies.
According to Taran Adarsh, the film would witness a record-breaking opening weekend and an exceptional first week.
Rachel Saltz from The New York Times observed that the film's humor was frequently crude.
Rachel Saltz also noted that the film had a frenetic pace.
Rachel Saltz further mentioned that the film contained some objectionable racial elements.
